Provided for - up to carriers to seek access
Provided for - up to carriers to seek access.

Schedule 1 of the Telecommunications Act 1997 provides that a carrier may request another carrier to give it access to other carrier's facilities. The Facilities Access Code, made by the ACCC under Schedule 1 of the Telecommunications Act 1997, encourages the co-location of facilities, where reasonably practicable.

Aerial site sharing can be imposed pursuant to articles 25 to 27 of the 13 July 2005 Telecommunications Act. Collocation could in theory also be imposed pursuant to Article 28 of the Telecommunications Act but is in practice always part of a package of remedies imposed on an SMP-operator in the framework of a market analysis pursuant to Article 61.

Aerial site sharing can be imposed pursuant to articles 25 to 27 of the 13 July 2005 Telecommunications Act. Collocation of other sites can in theory also be imposed pursuant to Article 28 of the Telecommunications Act. But this type of colocation is up until now always part of a package of remedies imposed on an SMP-operator in the framework of a market analysis pursuant to Article 61 of the Telecommunications Act.

Some infrastructure (ducts, local loop unbundling, towers, ect.) sharing is mandated according to remedies to SMP operator (Operator having Significant Market Power) and some is regulated according to general legistlation (all parties negotiate agreements for infrastructure sharing but if they bring dispute to the Communications Regulatory Authority of Republic of Lithuania, we may oblige to provide access to particular services or particular prices).
